document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

0B8A5FB4071540C7B4DBFDE46B94D07B.description:
Acquire and accurately use developmentally appropriate academic and domain-specific words and phrases.
Gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

A2BD2A36D9B3410BB96B55212ACD79DA.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and
listening at the college and career-readiness level.

A1B739DF968243E6ACFD99D5037E6E22.description:
Apply words that signal contrast (e.g., addition, however, although, nevertheless, similarly,
moreover, in addition) to provide subtle differences in meaning.

BBD37548CA33421DACDFFA28CF0C34F7.description: Apply synonyms, antonyms, and homographs appropriately to demonstrate meaning.

7F3B63E97F7045FDBF022742CA20BAC5.description: Recognize, explain, analyze, and apply common idioms, sayings, and proverbs.

5277F8F62AD84C6FA332C644A4B0C5EB.description:
Appropriately identify, interpret, and integrate figurative language, including personification,
similes, and metaphors, into writing and speaking.

E425CC69F8F34D8F8B15186F221DAA7B.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

67FDF572C63A445FAA9C9194A119141C.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

23C4DD126018443FAAAD76C3D4A42B27.description: Check predicted word meanings through context or using a dictionary.

E7C3B362713A4A6AB9395FB4311F0996.description:
Consult both digital and print reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to
find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

FA6778BF647745E7A4225EAA11C5F1D8.description: Use common Greek or Latin affixes and roots to help determine the meaning of a word (e.g., - able: affordable/sociable/disposable).

E5961D76540945DD9BEF2B028931856F.description: Use context clues and other strategies to help determine the meaning of a word or phrase.

A2263B37BF2B42DDB3BEC71837A55ECD.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on developmentally appropriate reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

388D48E4B9374373B05B98C71BC66FB9.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and
consulting reference materials.

99F263310F114DC1987AF7D1A66231CD.description:
Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in stories, dramas,
or poems.

BC6F7BA00EB64594BF7520691BED628E.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

276234599E734CEE856ED0FCF317E6C3.description: Demonstrate knowledge of correct language usage when writing, speaking, or reading.

EC4B776E768D419D9DE7CB333D08B70A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and
comprehension.

430F6087171445D7848D146310B9430C.description: Correctly spell grade-appropriate words, consulting references as needed.

0CBDD0E188C4422A8A65DB2F48650DBA.description: Correctly apply comma rules in all situations.

9FEB814BAD104FE7A748F13A70468D5D.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

F5D955A259CA4E50822A08824F1759FB.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

EE9911C574344AC7A14EE523A05DB795.description: Correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

12B6B7A7A6DD474789820F00F8917F29.description: Apply knowledge of subject-verb agreement to write and speak effectively.

B21EEA285BE74774A7C8FA9580048197.description:
Apply appropriate verb tenses to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions. Use
linking and helping verbs.

454E3BF541FB441A8F63E033059BED71.description:
Form and appropriately use the perfect verb tenses (e.g., I had walked. / I have walked. / I will
have walked.).

67668A669E744D9591CCA6A9A9B88C0B.description: Use conjunctions in writing and speech (e.g., and, but, for, nor, or, so).

CF203044E83E4C4F9A83EFE5173B7AE5.description: Correctly use and explain the function of prepositions in general and in sentences.

90B21C0604294C838881442D2B5DA926.description:
Use pronouns (including intensive pronouns) correctly and ensure that they are in the proper
case (subjective, objective, possessive).

1871FC6507F7462BA1227F6276800028.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

777E865FB0B948A7866CF527BBC9DCF7.description:
Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage when writing (e.g., using various sentence types, such as
compound, complex, and simple).

844FFB454CD948F4889212D5003BCF47.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

4DAE351FECBC412CA8794D5E770F756D.description:
Write routinely over extended periods of time (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter periods of
time (a single sitting or 1–2 days) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

68D1E7FE34824C1AA3B56551BBC84046.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5E7A9A4D7B574606B0AB9C50F678A3EC.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research in writing.

A510D220BF3E4BB98585326B799B9566.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

E10450F3A49848BF8F39FEDABD75D25B.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and
digital sources.

AE3FA1A0F176497DA21B620195B35E1F.description: Using multiple sources, participate in or conduct research to gather information that answers questions about a single topic.

C307D1C65619437A827B5822227F661E.description:
With increasing independence and using multiple sources, conduct short research projects that build knowledge
on a topic.

F3E3600C27A9445DB2D0CB66A2EDC495.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

FC8E9B24EDC0420EBCFEC87A091FD9B7.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

CE51FB20730C40B38ED5798947ACDC5F.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

0B812960BA7E484EA9F8D6913B96BB5D.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. Apply appropriate sentence structure and word order.

5001873B65214D82BD7BF6DAC2171045.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

4EFAC0261E29483490F65A559624E226.description:
Use transitional words or phrases, conjunctions, and other cohesive devices to better
organize and increase the length of writing in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 5 or more words per sentence.)

23DE2FAD03D1479DA43194194AF93890.description: Write literary texts with descriptive and narrative paragraphs to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

A91B84A6D80E45E9B8EAEF7A2AA8CCB1.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

B596D1BC047E41A8A403BC75AD8DB818.description: Provide a clear concluding statement that restates the topic or thesis.

A0A7AF952C8246BAB8533AACCB8B7EF1.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts.

8E7DFC6FE1B84B9F8CC5837263C2976B.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

C9590D45CDFA45EFBFE370E607069FBE.description:
Write informational texts to examine a topic and convey ideas with increasing independence using paragraphs of 5 or more sentences, using proper text organization, grammar structure, and spelling. (Include 5 or more words
per sentence.)

AB0BAB7338E14C84A3850CFDC77602FD.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

0231F539FDA8417C839B098716C48B14.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

A48564DFAE7B4B5A9AFAE3FEC214EDBD.description: Support claim(s) with clear reasoning and relevant evidence.

71475A12B3564B4CB502A7F7C8EC8C9A.description:
Justify opinions or persuade others by expressing appropriate/accurate reasoning and using some textual evidence or relevant background knowledge on the content in paragraphs of 5 or more sentences. (Include 5 or
more words per sentence.)

CFE0D8C0EE694FD58EEF919504FB83F8.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

F44173F531074DF08717C165A61C8978.description:
Read and comprehend literature from Puerto Rico and other cultures (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and
informational texts (e.g., history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

A38215F8E1224947A19FBD7AC6D3B3ED.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

55EF3CCE0A734A30867B5907CECB2C95.description:
Integrate information from several informational texts on the same topic in order to write or speak
about the subject knowledgeably.

39EEEC2FC95E49739F7D978398F4A09D.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their
approaches to similar themes and topics.

A3E5291474BF45558645C329C80F3D34.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

5AE38D968B0C4A588396135AF933A2E7.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, including, but not limited to,
narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

EF4E1B64A244481E85644C4D3FEF624B.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

DBCDB78216824A77BA4F5D40B7283BC2.description:
Distinguish information from a variety of informational texts (e.g., books, magazines, newspapers, and websites) using the most valuable informational source to locate an answer, cite a source, or
solve a problem.

8C86750917E042C49D23C3CC5286FC8A.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a
literary text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

1521CD84B1F24E79902B83C3F56C8839.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

70CAE1AA11474F69AF703FF9CA114F95.description:
Analyze the same event or topic from different informational text sources, noting similarities
and differences in the point of view they represent.

0BB2B8E5C3EB4F5EB4A6AE988D6D29CE.description:
Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described in a
literary text.

EE9B26230E4E42BD987AEA6D98751808.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

4DDBDC1E1F2C40D68DA78DE3E06422E7.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect,
problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in 2 or more informational texts.

BE341FDF94754E5AA41A3105B85FCAF9.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure
of a particular story, drama, or poem.

1FB213C64EE040FE841A3EDC0324FA78.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

66F5CBE5CDBF4D61BF328E120AFD990B.description:
Determine the meaning of academic and content-specific words and phrases in an
informational text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

16CF54C66AD649F480AB72A4B06726A4.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, including
figurative language.

295129F31B67412082FE3502394ABAE7.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

2B072F20065F427AA6C84DF185E1F7A9.description: Explain the relationships or interactions between 2 or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

0074051D07A14E9E8B6F6E5AA103034B.description: Compare and contrast characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

823EFC7ED3584334AA46F70F06F06666.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

7E83583D38A5414281D46DC6BE7A17A8.description:
Determine the main idea(s) of an informational text to analyze or evaluate how they are
supported by key details. Summarize the text.

8BC93FB4621E4E85B3EDA3514E508F6A.description:
Determine a theme from a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects
upon a topic. Summarize the text.

90AE492F5D01466C9D52AD48D03E98B2.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

599EA110A1154112969BE62B1FB2FB9F.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

135E5D78D4374A6B96AF1101A323D110.description:
Use in-depth critical reading of a variety of relevant texts and genres and viewing of multimedia resources (when accessible) to explain and evaluate main ideas, phenomena, processes, cultural identities, and relationships and
to express inferences and conclusions, quoting accurately from a text.

663FD242D6784FC4939700F4D268E58F.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

B90BE5DEE5764CD0B577161F5DE025F8.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

AD4F497E18734788A0CFEBC40C6C2F86.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate rate and expression on
successive readings.

C2E04C8D68334A61A582B4B88EBE4462.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

93541E1C6CA5425D9E4622560F3C3D82.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

B87955EA6798489E9A3CD4C0F1113429.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all grade-level letter-
sound correspondences and syllabication patterns.

2FA715644496432D915AE2CB6880D35A.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., base words, roots, and affixes) to accurately read unfamiliar multisyllabic
words in and out of context.

435150D660DC4B5E931E4621317AAC69.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

BD4C0522FCF243E5A326439AECC39A77.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in spoken
monosyllabic words.

D0A47F8E56A94AA48D45F18C14085C6E.description:
Segment spoken monosyllabic words into their complete sequence of individual sounds
(phonemes).

6CF37F0382F0460D8B866F5C0BB33466.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken monosyllabic words.

8FA13573D45548FB8A86D0D2E07D89E1.description:
Manipulate sounds and words in shared, guided, and independent activities, such as
singing, read-alouds, or chants.

C66CB0B73C3B4FC6A1B44D5E40185766.description:
Decode monosyllabic and multisyllabic words as appropriate to the student’s
communication modality.

40631E82AF28483C98EBB39EA68ED3BB.description: Accurately segment monosyllabic and multisyllabic words.

0D9CD4A904A04F5591C321ED700393E6.description: Orally produce monosyllabic and multisyllabic words by accurately blending sounds.

96DA05DA2DE348F5BFB6C632B2716A25.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

C2340E5F8D4A49129232ECF4B0990D1E.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

21CEA2CAB7ED49678BB28D8DAC04F8CF.description:
Provide basic reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student
format.

F48828B005E545F09320D293C885AA84.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

58E522D04D184A74A0B9672ADA2A2FDF.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

2AA18B1B2778480C88EDD61ECB1F119E.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

3614DF0C93C64BFE858B72326A981167.description: Analyze and respond to a poem or work of art and compare 2 or more current events.

5E94CF95112845CD9EC178EF5C83BACF.description:
Retell texts and recount experiences using complete sentences, key words, and a growing number
of general, academic, and content-specific words in order to communicate with increasing precision.

F0878302A00545B0A9AB97A665F457ED.description: Plan and deliver oral presentations on a variety of topics and content areas using details and evidence to support ideas (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

E6B7D1233C584D13A7C87C57EAD3218D.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

D1D4A5F907C2400DB4366CD67C649047.description:
Describe and explain experiences, ideas, and concepts using appropriate grammar and vocabulary, adjusting
language choices according to the purpose, task, and audience.

45AFCD1BAC9C454C81095D6338C670A7.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

865BF9BA485142F39D7064A547B3E794.description:
Negotiate with or persuade others in conversations using grade-appropriate vocabulary and open responses to
provide and support counterarguments.

70BF6C33CEAE4498A37DF23CF0561600.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

036A33E68E06422A8D836E6C1511347D.description: Use appropriate vocabulary in context, including homonyms, homographs, synonyms, and antonyms, and grammatically correct language to discuss experiences and texts with precision and detail.

406FE9EA8702402991B1D13DD33DB27E.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

633597C4C57242DFA50010EF266936AE.description:
Expand and enrich sentences to provide details about a familiar or new activity, process, or
academic concept.

80E086ED94A243EE935DB08FDC07D461.description: Express self using correct simple, compound, and complex sentences.

D7CAA3EFB079440CB8EA6DC0E24AF027.description: Answer and formulate closed- and open-ended questions in both formal and informal discussions.

6720A5D7432546CE9F4B23B2E9AFAA0F.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

5006D04E38F34002BF0F713CBBA86BA3.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by taking turns, asking relevant questions, affirming others, adding relevant information, and paraphrasing key ideas.

DFA9A957D82F4C42ADE453027370CBF0.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

14A6CFE58E8D45218EFC5EE55C7ABBB2.description:
Listen and respond to a variety of literary and informational texts during read-alouds to comprehend and identify the main topic, details, and literary elements (character, setting,
etc.) (e.g., integrating print or technological/digital resources).

25259E0F7A90404CBDE2A7E74385CCB2.description:
Listen to, analyze, and respond to complex instructions, expressing self and using complete
sentences.

9ADF95E48476415DAEB1C8165B30ECAA.description: Interact in a socially appropriate manner.

C606F8ABCADE4F9B9DAE6E047187B756.description:
Listen attentively, stay focused, ask/answer detailed closed- and open-ended questions, express appropriate reasoning, and begin to express opinions or clarify positions using
complete sentences and correct grammar.

6F724C2272994971BBE4B8B154524ECD.description: Listen to and interact with peers during group discussions or participation, and oral presentations.

B0A90520088E404D8FEAFFB8816BEFEF.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
